cab.content: printed for the War Cabinet. january jri943 SECRET.:W.M. (43)tilth Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND key it is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document war CABINET 11 (43).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Tuesday, January 19, 1943, at 5 p.m.Present:The Right Hon; C. R. Attlee, M.P., Deputy Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.The Right Hon. Herbert Morrison,M.P., Secretary of State for theHome Department and Minister ofHome Security.The following were also present:The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Viscount Cranborne,Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon. Sir archibald sinclair, Bt., M.P., Secretary ofState for Air.The Right Hon. Sir James Grigg,M.P., Secretary of State for War.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Crlpps,K.C., M.P., Minister of aircraft production.The Hon. Sir Alexander Cadogan,Permanent Under-Secretary of Statefor Foreign Affairs.Sir Edward Bridges, Secretary.French North The War Cabinet were informed of the latest developments in africa. this matter.General de A record of the discussion and of the Conclusions reached is,Gaulle and contained in the Secretary's Standard File of War cabinet general Giraud. Conclusions.(previous reference:W.M. (43) 9thConclusions.)Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,January 19, 1943- -
